wms_article.title: A million more foreign residents could boost Korea’s economy

wms_article_body.body: Bringing an additional one million foreign residents to South Korea could generate an economic boost equivalent to 6 percent of the nation’s gross domestic product (GDP), according to new research. The Korea Chamber of Commerce and Industry announced the findings on Wednesday in a report conducted jointly with a research team led by Kim Duk-pa, a professor at Korea University’s Department of Economics. Using panel regression analysis of data from 2012 to 2023 across 17 provinces and regions, the study examined how annual inflows of foreign residents affect economic growth. It found that a 1 percent increase in the share of registered foreign residents in the economically active population leads to roughly a 0.11 percent rise in per capita regional GDP. Based on 2023 figures, the findings suggest that welcoming one million more registered foreigners would yield an economic effect worth around 145 trillion won ($105 billion).
